justification: "Interestingly, Stroop inhibition is the only cognitive task to consistently distinguish suicide attempters from suicide ideators" – identifying Stroop inhibition (the task) as the operational measure of cognitive control.
"Initial studies of decision-making employing the Iowa Gambling Task (IGT)" – explicitly linking the construct of decision-making to the IGT measure.
"…using a three-armed bandit task, suicide attempters… failed to encode one-back reinforcement" – showing the bandit task is the instrument for assessing learning processes.
"…in some, but not all, studies of deterministic learning using the Wisconsin Card Sort" – indicating the WCST is used to measure cognitive flexibility/learning.
"…the Cambridge Gamble found that older depressed suicide attempters made more stochastic choices…" – the Cambridge Gamble Task is presented as the tool for assessing risk-sensitive decisions.
"…a study using the GDT adolescent suicide attempters made choices that were more risk-seeking and/or stochastic" – linking the Game of Dice Task to risky decision behaviour.
"…laboratory measures (e.g., Go-No Go tasks …) self-report measures of impulsivity often find weak and/or inconsistent effects" – listing the Go-No Go task as an impulsivity measure.
The same sentence cites "the Balloon Analog Risk Task" among "laboratory measures… of impulsivity," identifying BART as an impulsivity instrument.
"Early studies have associated an exaggerated preference for immediate over delayed rewards – delay discounting…" – referring to delay-discounting paradigms as the measure of intertemporal choice.
